# make_hyperlink { #turtle_island.make_hyperlink }

```python
make_hyperlink(text, url, new_tab=True, *, name='hyperlink')
```

Returns a Polars expression that generates an HTML hyperlink (`<a>` tag) for each row.

::: {.callout-tip}
# Credit: gt-extras
This function is heavily inspired by the [gt-extras](https://github.com/posit-dev/gt-extras) package.
:::

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

<code>[**text**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [str]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   Column name containing the display text for the hyperlink.

<code>[**url**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [str]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   Column name containing the destination URL.

<code>[**new_tab**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [bool]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [True]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Whether the link opens in a new browser tab (`target="_blank"`) or the current tab. Defaults to `True`.

<code>[**name**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [str]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [\'hyperlink\']{.parameter-default}</code>

:   The name of the resulting column. Defaults to "hyperlink".

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

<code>[]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [pl.Expr]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   A Polars expression generating the HTML anchor tag.

## Examples {.doc-section .doc-section-examples}

Create an HTML anchor tag (`<a>`) combining link text and URL from two columns:
```{python}
import polars as pl
import turtle_island as ti

pl.Config.set_fmt_str_lengths(200)
df = pl.DataFrame(
    {
        "name": ["Turtle Island"],
        "url": ["https://github.com/jrycw/turtle-island"],
    }
)
new_df = df.with_columns(ti.make_hyperlink("name", "url"))
new_df
```
```{python}
new_df.style
```
